topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Managing Your Cloud with the HCG Dashboard

body.p: The HCG Dashboard UI is a cloud management tool that allows users to define, deploy, manage, and monitor a HPE Helion OpenStack cloud. The tool helps you provide and validate the cloud definitions required to deploy your cloud and guide you through the deployment.
Click the List of Clouds link to open the List of Cloud Definitions table where you can see a list of cloud definitions and the current status of any cloud associated with the definition.
You can also use the List of Cloud Definitions table to open the Input for Cloud table to edit the cloud definition or open the Deploy Cloud table to deploy that cloud definition.

section.title: Restart services
section.p: After a cloud is deployed, you can use the List of Clouds table to reset services including:

ul.li: Centralized Logging services (Beaver, Logstash, ElasticSearch, Kibana, Icinga)

section.p:
To restart services:
Launch the HCG Dashboard.
Click List of Clouds in the Cloud panel. The List of Cloud Definitions table opens.
For the cloud you want to work with, click Manage. The Manage services table opens.
Restart the services as needed:
Restart the services in the Standard Region. Click the Restart All button to restart the listed services on the Standard Region controllers.
Restart a service on all controllers in the Standard Region. For the service you want to restart, click the restart button in the Action column.
Restart a service on one Standard Region controller. Click the Node list to select the controller. Then, click the restart button in the Action column.

section.title: Edit a cloud definition
section.p: To edit the cloud definition for an existing cloud, click the Edit button next to the cloud definition.
The Input for Cloud table appears, where you can edit the values as needed.

section.title: Deploy a cloud definition
section.p: To deploy a cloud definition for an existing cloud, click the Deploy button next to the cloud definition.
The cloud deploy table appears, where you can deploy the definition.
